info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 8:13PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE THIS EVENING THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... A weak area of low pressure will move across the area with light snow showers possible. Scattered snow showers may begin across the southwestern North Carolina mountains and spread further south and east into the overnight. Light accumulations are possible, mainly in the far southwestern North Carolina mountains, across extreme northeast Georgia, and portions of the South Carolina mountains. Up to a half-inch of snow is possible in the aforementioned locations. A few scattered flurries could develop into portions of the Upper Savannah River Valley and Upstate South Carolina as well. Snow will taper off before sunrise. Those traveling should be prepared for a few isolated slick spots and lower visibility. Use caution and allow for extra time to reach your destination. Continue monitoring NOAA Weather Radio and our website for the latest information, forecasts, and warnings.
